comments: Numbers that are congruent to {0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6} mod 8.Numbers n such that binary expansion does not end 111.Complement of A004771. - _Michel Marcus_, Sep 11 2015
links: Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (1,0,0,0,0,0,1,-1).
mathematica: DeleteCases[Range[0,100],_?(Mod[#,8]==7&)] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Apr 01 2011 *)Select[Range[0, 100], ! MemberQ[{7}, Mod[#, 8]] &] (* _Vincenzo Librandi_, Sep 12 2015 *)
prog: (PARI) A004777=n->(n-1)*8\7 \\ _M. F. Hasler_, Nov 02 2013(MAGMA) [n-1+Floor((n-1)/7) : n in [1..100]]; // _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Sep 11 2015(MAGMA) [n: n in [0..100] | not n mod 8 in [7]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Sep 11 2015
